quest.name: All You Wanted to Know about Odin
journal: Simmie would entrust you with a delivery.

With your aid, Simmie has completed her report on the ghostly horseman sighted in the Shroud─now identified as the primal Odin. Return to the Waking Sands and deliver a copy of the report to Urianger.
After perusing the report, Urianger shares with you his misgivings about the historical accuracy of the scriptures. Casting light upon the events of ages past is a tall task, indeed.
objectives: Deliver the Odin report to Urianger.

dialogue.name: SIMMIE
dialogue.text: Your assistance in the investigation has proven invaluable, adventurer. You have our thanks.

dialogue.name: SIMMIE
dialogue.text: With your aid, I have finally managed to complete my report─a thorough survey of all eyewitness reports, along with the most credible theories regarding the Dark Divinity's presence in the Shroud.

dialogue.name: SIMMIE
dialogue.text: I intend to deliver copies of the report to Brother O–App–Pesi and Bowlord Lewin myself.

dialogue.name: SIMMIE
dialogue.text: The Scions, too, will no doubt be eager to learn of our findings. I would be most appreciative if you could deliver a copy to Urianger in my stead.

dialogue.name: SIMMIE
dialogue.text: My duties demand that I remain composed, but in all truth, I fear for the fate of our people. Should the time come that the Dark Divinity draws his blade against Gridania, promise me that we can count on your aid.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Forename, I am most heartened by thy safe return. Wert thou able to cast light on the shadows that haunt the Shroud?

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: ...So it is true. Having awakened from nigh-eternal slumber, the Dark Divinity now rides free in the Shroud.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Whilst you were afield, I immersed myself in the scriptures. The more I scoured the words, the more I did realize that the writings draw heavily upon Allagan historical chronicles.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: History is quite a fascinating beast, is it not? One nation's glory is another's suffering─one nation's great hero, another's most abhorrent villain.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: I mean not to speak in platitudes, only to say that there is never but a single side to any story─even a story that is presented as historical fact.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: To what end did the great hero of Allag seal Odin in a gaol of crystal? What impels the Dark Divinity to ride once again? Cast thine light on the shadows of history, friend, that we might be delivered from the darkness.

obj.n: Fear and Odin in the Shroud
